com.flemil.ui
Interface TextItem

All Superinterfaces:
Item
All Known Implementing Classes:
CheckBox, ComboBox, Label, RadioButton, TextField
public interface TextItem
extends Item

Interface that represents an Item that contains text or that can be used to display text to the user

Author:
Solomon Kariri

Method Detail

setFont

void setFont(javax.microedition.lcdui.Font font)
Sets the Font that is going to be used by this TextItem to render its text. If this method is not called for a component, thhis TextItem will use the font defined by the current Style for the whole application. Calling this method for a TextItem isolates it from the effects of theming on Font such that the TextItems font is not affected by theme changes.

Parameters:
font - the Font to be used for rendering font for this TextItem

getFont

javax.microedition.lcdui.Font getFont()
Returns the Font that this TextItem uses to render its text

Returns:
Font that this TextItem uses to render its text

setTextWraps

void setTextWraps(boolean textWraps)
Sets whether this TextItems should wrap it's text and hence occupy more space on the screen such that all the text in this TextItem is fully visible to the user at all times provided this Items displayRect falls fully within the visible area of the application. Passing a value of false to this method makes the text item scroll its contents automatically when focused on.

Parameters:
textWraps - true for this TextItem to wrap its content and false otherwise

isTextWraps

boolean isTextWraps()
Returns true if text wrapping is enabled for this TextItem and false otherwise.

Returns:
true if text wrapping is enabled for this TextItem and false otherwise.

setAlignment

void setAlignment(byte alignment)
Sets the alignment to be used for text by this TextItem. The value of this parameter should be one of the values TextItem.ALIGN_LEFT, TextItem.ALIGN_RIGHT, or TextItem.ALIGN_CENTER

Parameters:
alignment - the alignment to be used for text by this TextItem.

getAlignment

byte getAlignment()
Returns the alignment being used for text by this TextItem. The return value is one of the values TextItem.ALIGN_LEFT, TextItem.ALIGN_RIGHT, or TextItem.ALIGN_CENTER

Returns:
the alignment being used for text by this TextItem.

getText

java.lang.String getText()
Retuns the text being currently displayed by this TextItem

Returns:
the text being currently displayed by this TextItem

setText

void setText(java.lang.String text)
Sets the text to be displayed by this TextItem

Parameters:
text - the text to be displayed by this TextItem
